intro: Koeleria alpicola, commonly known as the alpine koeleria, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Koeleria alpicola is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various small organisms.
